revised_title: Isoleucine Biosynthesis in Paracoccus denitrificans: The Pyruvate Elongation Pathway
tldr: The study investigates the growth of Paracoccus denitrificans on succinate and succinate, analyzing the metabolites using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry. The distribution of label in isoleucine indicates that the 2-ketobutyrate required for isoleucine biosynthesis is mainly produced through the pyruvate elongation pathway. A small proportion of isoleucine is also produced via an alternative route involving propionyl and 2-ketobutyrate synthase. Threonine and glutamate are not used as sources of 2-ketobutyrate production for isoleucine biosynthesis under these growth conditions.
